intro: Launaea petitiana, commonly known as the small-launaea, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with narrow, gray-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. Launaea petitiana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
